clinical_study.brief_title: Response of Korean Medicine Hospital to COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: Hospital Operational Response Strategy and Experience During the COVID-19 Pandemic in a Spine-specialty Korean Medicine Training Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The objectives of this study are to report the response strategy to prevent COVID-19 spread implemented at a Korean medicine hospital, and the satisfaction survey results regarding its preventive measures.

detailed_description.textblock: The objectives of this study are (1) to report the response strategy to prevent COVID-19 spread implemented at a Korean medicine hospital situated in Seoul, Korea, (2) to describe patient visit trends compared to the number of confirmed COVID-19 cases during the COVID-19 peak in February - April 2020, and (3) to provide results of a satisfaction survey regarding its preventive measures.

primary_outcome.measure: Satisfactory service regarding hospital response to COVID-19
primary_outcome.description: Multiple choice question on satisfactory service regarding hospital response to COVID-19, if any

secondary_outcome.measure: Feelings of apprehension regarding hospital visits
secondary_outcome.description: Likert scale question on level of feelings of apprehension before hospital visits due to COVID-19

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical staff wearing of facial masks and hand hygiene
secondary_outcome.description: Likert scale question on level of maintenance of wearing of facial masks and hand hygiene in medical staff

secondary_outcome.measure: Cleanliness and sterilization of hospital facilities
secondary_outcome.description: Likert scale question on level of cleanliness and sterilization of hospital facilities with regard to COVID-19 spread prevention

secondary_outcome.measure: Convenience and accessibility of hand sanitizers
secondary_outcome.description: Likert scale question on level of convenience and accessibility of hand sanitizers

secondary_outcome.measure: Helpfulness and readability of posters and stand-up banners
secondary_outcome.description: Likert scale question on level of helpfulness and readability of posters and stand-up banners with COVID-19 information in the hospital

secondary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction with hospital safety measures for COVID-19
secondary_outcome.description: Likert scale question on level of satisfaction with hospital safety measures for COVID-19

secondary_outcome.measure: Recommendation of hospital to friends and family
secondary_outcome.description: Likert scale question on level of recommendation of this hospital to friends and family concerned with visiting hospitals due to COVID-19

arm_group.description: Jaseng Hospital of Korean medicine conducted a pen and paper survey on patient satisfaction with regard to its COVID-19 response in inpatients hospitalized and outpatients visiting during March 23-25, 2020.

intervention.description: The patient satisfaction survey consisted of 8 items, including 7 Likert scale questions and 1 multiple choice question.

study_pop.textblock: Inpatients hospitalized and outpatients visiting Jaseng Hospital of Korean medicine during March 23-25, 2020

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Inpatients hospitalized at Jaseng Hospital of Korean medicine during March 23-25, 2020
- Outpatients visiting Jaseng Hospital of Korean medicine during March 23-25, 2020
Exclusion Criteria:
- Visitors visiting Jaseng Hospital of Korean medicine during March 23-25, 2020 for purposes other than treatment
